'''Altaria''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''チルタリス''' ''Tyltalis'') is a dual-type {{2t|Dragon|Flying}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Swablu}} starting at [[level]] 35. It can [[Mega Evolution|Mega Evolve]] into '''Mega Altaria''' using the [[Altarianite]].

==Biology==
Altaria is a blue, avian Pokémon. Its body and cloud-like wings are covered in fluffy, white feathers. It often folds its wings behind it, obscuring its back. Two long, blue plumes extend like streamers from the back of its head. It has a short, hooked beak and prominent cheek patches, both of which are white. Additionally, it has beady, black eyes. It has a long neck and short legs protruding from its fluffy body. The feet are blue with four toes, three claws forward and one backward. The tail is made up of five feathers, the outer two being longer than the inner ones.

Mega Altaria has more extensive cloud-like plumage, with a large, fluffy mass extending from its back. The feathers have grown as a self-protective measure, and they glimmer with an iridescent sheen. Its cottony wings are more distinct than in its base form, and its blue belly is now exposed. Additional fluff surrounds its neck like a collar, and its head is adorned with a hat-like crest. A single, small feather curls out from its forehead, though its facial features are unchanged. Its tail feathers have grown into a long, wavy streamer, with three longer central plumes. Mega Altaria's singing voice is even more beautiful than that of its regular form. It is known for its sociable personality and is not timid.<ref>http://www.pokemonrubysapphire.com/en-us/pokemon/new-mega-evolutions/mega-altaria</ref>

This Pokémon uses its wings to catch updrafts and soar across the sky. It gracefully glides through the clouds, often while singing or humming in a soprano voice. Its voice seems to have special properties which induce a dreamy state for listeners. Altaria can be very affectionate, enveloping people it has bonded with in its cotton-like wings. Altaria is often found living in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Forest Pokémon|forests}}, though it also inhabits mountain ranges.

==In the anime==
===In the main series===
[[File:Titus Altaria.png|thumb|250px|left|Altaria in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
====Major appearances====
=====[[Winona's Altaria]]=====
[[Winona]]'s Altaria appeared in ''[[AG085|Sky High Gym Battle!]]''. [[Ash's Grovyle]] battled against it in {{Ash}}'s Gym battle against her, and won.

=====Other=====
An Altaria appeared in ''[[AG101|Vanity Affair]]'', belonging to [[Drake]] of the {{DL|Elite Four|Hoenn Elite Four}}. It battled against Ash's Grovyle.

A flock of Altaria and {{p|Swablu}} was seen in ''[[AG171|Pokémon Ranger - Deoxys' Crisis! (Part 1)]]''. The Altaria's sense of direction had gone haywire, so [[Solana]] captured one of them to put them back in order.

Grandma Wilma was training an Altaria, which appeared in ''[[DP156|A Meteoric Rise to Excellence!]]''.

An Altaria appeared in ''[[DP174|Last Call — First Round!]]'', under the ownership of [[Nando]]. It first participated in the [[Appeal|Performance Stage]] of the [[Sinnoh Grand Festival]]. It performed alongside his {{p|Kricketot}} and helped Nando advance to the [[Contest Battle]]s.

Two Altaria appeared in a flashback in ''[[BW101|Drayden Versus Iris: Past, Present, and Future!]]''. One was a Pokémon that students from the Opelucid Academy could borrow in order to learn how to battle, and the other was one of the Pokémon that {{an|Iris}} befriended.

A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Altaria appeared in ''[[XY077|A Relay in the Sky!]]'', where it was seen participating in the [[Pokémon Sky Relay]]. [[Jessie's Pumpkaboo]] was found to have stowed away to take advantage and give {{TRT}} a lead in the race.

An Altaria appeared in ''[[XY125|A League of His Own!]]'', under the ownership of [[Titus]]. It was used in the [[Lumiose Conference]], but was easily defeated after [[Ash's Greninja]] transformed into Ash-Greninja.

{{an|Lillie}} used an Altaria as a [[Poké Ride|Ride Pokémon]] in [[SM061]].

====Minor appearances====
Altaria debuted in ''[[M06|Jirachi: Wish Maker]]''. It was one of the Pokémon that lived in [[Forina]], {{OBP|Jirachi|M06}}'s home.

Altaria made its main series debut in ''[[AG064|True Blue Swablu]]'', where multiple Altaria were members of the flock that an injured Swablu belonged to.

An Altaria appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M07|Destiny Deoxys]]''.

An Altaria had a cameo appearance in ''[[M08|Lucario and the Mystery of Mew]]''. It was seen in a flock with some Swablu, living in the [[Tree of Beginning]].

A group of Altaria, {{p|Sentret}}, {{p|Furret}}, {{p|Shroomish}}, and {{p|Swablu}} helped {{OBP|Pokémon Ranger|Ranger series}} [[Jack Walker]] when he was a young boy in a blizzard as seen in a flashback in ''[[M09|Pokémon Ranger and the Temple of Sea]]''.

An Altaria appeared in ''[[DP010|Not on MY Watch Ya Don't!]]'', under the ownership of a {{pkmn|Coordinator}}.

Multiple Altaria made a brief cameo appearance in ''[[M11|Giratina and the Sky Warrior]]''.

Multiple Altaria appeared in ''[[BW130|Butterfree and Me!]].''

Multiple Altaria appeared in ''[[M19|Volcanion and the Mechanical Marvel]]'', and three were among the Pokémon seen at [[Nebel Plateau]].

[[File:Mega Altaria ORAS Trailer.png|thumb|250px|Mega Altaria in the animated trailer]]
A [[Mega Evolution|Mega]] Altaria appeared in the [[Pokémon Omega Ruby and Pokémon Alpha Sapphire Animated Trailer]], under the ownership of {{ga|May}}. It was seen participating in a {{pkmn|Contest|Pokémon Contest Spectacular}} alongside May and Mega {{p|Audino}}.
{{-}}

==In the manga==
[[File:Winona Altaria Adventures.png|thumb|200px|Altaria in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
{{main|Winona's Altaria}}
[[Winona]] of the Fortree Gym has an Altaria as her main Pokémon, much as in the games. It was briefly seen carrying Winona and [[Flannery]] to the [[Weather Institute]] after [[Norman]]'s battle with {{adv|Ruby}} in ''[[PS211|Hanging Around With Slaking III]]'', but wasn't seen fighting until ''[[PS226|I Dare Ya, Altaria... Knock Chic off My Shoulder]]'', where it fought {{adv|Sapphire}}'s [[Chic]] and managed to win even after the latter evolved into a {{p|Blaziken}}.

An Altaria was one of {{adv|Ruby}}'s opponents in the Normal Rank Beauty Contest in [[Verdanturf Town]] in ''[[PS217|Mind-Boggling with Medicham]]''.

[[Lisia]] also owns an Altaria nicknamed Ali, who first appeared in ''[[PAORAS00|Omega Alpha Adventure 0]]''.

In ''[[PAORAS04|Omega Alpha Adventure 4]]'', an Altaria was silhouetted in {{Steven}}'s explanation about the [[Draconid people]].

An Altaria appeared in ''[[PAORAS16|Omega Alpha Adventure 16]]'' under the ownership of {{adv|Wally}}.

An Altaria appeared in Pokémon - The Legend of the Dragon King.

==Trivia==
* No other Pokémon have the same [[Egg Group]] combination as Altaria and its {{p|Swablu|pre-evolution}}. In this case, they are included in both the {{egg|Flying}} and {{egg|Dragon}} Egg Groups.
* No other Pokémon have the [[List of Pokémon with unique type combinations|same type combination]] as Mega Altaria.
** It is also the only {{type|Fairy}} Pokémon weak to Fairy-type moves.
* Altaria is the quickest Dragon-type Pokémon to level up, needing only 600,000 experience points to reach level 100.
* Altaria is the only Pokémon to have two {{tcg|Prerelease cards}}.

===Origin===
Altaria is likely based on a {{wp|Peng (mythology)|Peng}}, a Chinese legendary bird of enormous size, said to travel 3000 {{wp|li (unit)|li}} in one flap of its mighty, cloud-like wings. It is often portrayed as having a fish's head and whiskers.

The shape of the fluff on Mega Altaria's head may draw inspiration from {{wp|Dutch cap}}s.

===Name origin===
Altaria is a combination of ''{{wp|alto}}'' (Spanish and Italian for ''high'') or ''altus'' (Latin for ''high'') and ''aria'' (Italian for ''air''). ''{{wp|Aria}}'' in music can refer to expressive melody, relating to Altaria's singing abilities. It may also refer to the star {{wp|Altair}}, the brightest star in the constellation {{wp|Aquila (constellation)|Aquila}}, the Eagle.

Tyltalis may refer to ''{{wp|Epsilon Draconis|Tyl}}''—also known as Epsilon Draconis—a star in the constellation {{wp|Draco (constellation)|Draco}}, the Dragon. It may also be a reference to the play ''L'Oiseau Bleu'' (''{{wp|The Blue Bird (play)|The Blue Bird}}'') by Belgian playwright {{wp|Maurice Maeterlinck}}. The story is about two siblings, Mytyl and Tyltyl (ミチル ''Michiru'' and チルチル ''Chiruchiru'' in the Japanese translation of the play), who are tasked with finding the "blue bird of happiness."
